text: lives stolen in an instant it is too
much to bear in Ankara at the reality of
the horror sank in and it was
overwhelming families of those killed in
Turkey's worst ever attack taken to see
the bodies of their loved ones and
unable to speak one mother is carried
away overcome with grief I wish I were
dead he says to witness this and to be
alive now is too terrible there is
intense pain here but also profound
anger towards the state and towards the
president who they believe has divided
this nation pitted one side against the
other whipped up a frenzy of ante
Kurdish violence with such devastating
consequences
the weekend began here with a rally for
peace ripped apart by twin blasts
killing dozens the crime scene Ankara
train station has reopened already under
repair perhaps too early beneath the
white card new body parts found on the
ground a simple tribute one for each
victim among the mourners defiance
thousands gathered furious at the
government for a lack of security which
they say allowed the bombers to strike
the friends comments that are that we
have lost will never never be with us
again how does that make you feel empty
tensions ran high with rouse over who
was to blame the leader of the
pro-kurdish HDP party said the
government had blood on its hands
urging people to end president Aaron's
rule with next month's election Turkey's
tragedy runs deep and the vulnerable
country is asking who would strike at
its very heart mark Lowen BBC news
Ankara
